title: How And Why Mindfulness Can Make You Happier, Calmer And More Productive Every Day - Indiatimes.com
text:
Regi George Jenarius February 23, 2017 
We often unknowingly find ourselves in an argument or getting all worked up within the confines of our minds; only to realise later that there was no one else but yourself to blame. 
Your mind runs loose with thoughts; sometimes, without even you knowing what the trigger is. And a lot of us suffer because of it as we constantly cause ourselves unnecessary stress and anxiety that results in us losing sleep over our self-created thoughts. 
acupressure.com.au 
We worry about things that are probably not even going to happen but play it out in our mind nevertheless. We end up spending a considerable amount of time creating an alternate reality in our mind instead of realising the reality that surrounds us. 
vgnvfklj.megaph.com 
Pandit Dasa, a mindful leadership and wellness expert, speaks about why our minds are untamed, how it can harm us, and what we can do to begin the process of cultivating control over our thoughts. What does it mean to have an untamed mind and how can it harm us? 
An ‘untamed’ mind, as the word suggests, is a mind that is off the leash and lacks any control. The problem with an untamed mind is that it harms our physical health. Your mind is capable of making you believe that you are in danger and causes your physical body to react as if the situation is playing out. 
revelationtv.com 
If you understand how your mind works and how its effects trickle down to your body, you will be able to zero in your mind as the primary cause of your problems and suffering. For instance, when you experience a nightmare your body begins to perspire, your heartbeat increases and so does your breathing because of what your mind creates. 
Mindfulness practices are not complicated—they just need to be performed consistently, which holds true for anything in life we want to reap benefits from.
